message.content:
cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.IT 

The paper discusses the challenges of video streaming over the Internet and proposes a new rate adaptation algorithm for HTTP-based adaptive streaming (HAS). The paper focuses on the network aspect of video streaming and discusses the impact of multiple HAS clients competing for network resources. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses video encoding and bitrate adaptation, which falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper proposes a new algorithm for rate adaptation, which involves probing the network and adapting the bitrate accordingly, which could fall under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) or cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper also discusses the use of TCP congestion control, which could fall under the category of cs.IT (Information Theory).
